mdRecord.dcterms:title: World War I nursing insignia
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: American Red Cross [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Items include: Red Cross Volunteer name plate, Mrs. C.C. Akers; Pin, Red Cross Home Nursing; Bar, Red Cross; Button, British (?) Crown; Button, U.S. Eagle; Pin, Army Nurses Corps (Caduceus); Pin, Red Cross 50 Years; Pin, Red Cross 45 Years; Pin, Crux S.P. Benedicti; Pin, Red Cross Instructor Home Nursing; Buttons, unknown pair; Red service stripes, belonging to Ella Thomas Whitten; Cross medal with ribbon, Fortes Creantur Fortibus (1917-1918, 1861-1865); Patch, American Red Cross Volunteer; Lapel insignia, U.S.; Patch, American Red Cross Nurse; Button, Flaming cannonball (?) design.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Armed forces--insignia
